6XLRfcKrX93OchdNbVL0WQ.text: Went last night and there was a long wait so we decided to order Togo instead. Although they were overwhelmed with customers, the food came out fast and fresh! Got home and the pizza and wings were amazing definitely going to visit again very soon!

TWPewhYP5j3UBzp5VLapYQ.text: Thanks to a good friend who brought me here for dinner, I was able to experience this cute little spot!  It was a warm night and we opted to be seated outside so that we could take advantage of the great weather.  I was in a pizza type of mood and decided with the help of our awesome server that I was going to order some thin crust.  But before talking about the pizza, I have to talk about our appetizer first:  BOOM Dip: Named after our infamous Kaboom Room, it's a delicious concoction of spinach, artichokes and cheeses served with our Italian chips for dipping.  If you like Spinach and Artichoke dip, then this is going to be right up your alley.-- It's oozing of melted cheese and artichoke and the chips are large enough to hold globs of dip into your mouth.  I loved this stuff and if you didn't take it away then I probably could have kept on eating it.    Clark Street Meat Pizza: (straight from the menu) It's the spicy meat lover's pizza that keeps on giving. It's loaded with our Chicago sausage, capicolla, salami, garlic, mozzarella, oregano, chili flakes, Parmesan and parmano cheeses, then finished with fresh basil and more parmano. You won't remember your name after a night with this hottie.--I ordered the medium size and it was enough to feed about three people at the least.  The only reason I'm taking off one star is because it was a bit salty for my tastes.  Other than that, they didn't skimp on toppings.  What made this place truly stand out was our server Lily (If I have her name wrong, please forgive me!!).  She was amazing-- took care of us from the moment we sat down and made us all want to come back just so that we could be seated in her section.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clark Meat Street Pizza.  It was huge!!
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach artichoke dip

mQd-VDrISrlojySHNp-iNQ.text: I eat at oregano's at least once a week but this one was amazing . We used the yelp waitlist and the estimated time was incorrect . Informed Ralph (manager) and he let us be seated right away and our food came out very fast .  Nikki was one of the sweetest waitresses i have had especially since we were placed in her area with food order already taken .

Tp2HM49rRGp-PZ9lnj45oA.text: My husband and I have been to many Oregano's and this was the far best! Annie was our server. She gave us excellent service. Never waited for water refills, our salad main dish and dessert came in the exact order and she came by to ask how the food was, very kind. If you stop by, ask for Annie and you won't be disappointed.

yPkClnqE7O7IibSuuswwrw.text: Worst service experience in awhile. I usually love Oreganos, but I won't be visiting this location again. The hostess wasn't there when we arrived and after standing awkwardly at the hostess station for over 5 minutes, the hostess came and asked us if "we were ready to be seated"!? No apologies."Yes, we're ready." Then the bartender couldn't make the drink I wanted because he would have had to go to the kitchen to get jalapenos.  I ordered the stuffed Riga Tony . It came with almost no sauce. I asked the waitress for more sauce  and she came back with it about 10 minutes later. I also requested a Diet Pepsi which never did make it. Dinner's not over yet, but I'm totally over it.

cASn0ZAisZ1iQLebDTH0oA.text: Excellent delicious food! Service borders on Spectacular! We have never enjoyed dinner that much before. I would go broke if I lived close to a location.

ngz9CFeRnrWvT5lx5Z4v8Q.text: Nothing beats an Italian dinner. I've been to this location many times for the past 4 years. Their food quality has always been top notch. The serves are nice and knowledgeable about the menu. I love how they're a family business, not just some giant corporate who likes to franchise their locations everywhere.   For today I ordered the meatball pasta with ice tea and man it couldn't get any better. The meat is well cooked although depending on your preference you can also get it medium done, medium rare, and so on. The noodles are juicy and well marinated, every bite is exceptionally delicious.   Overall, very satisfied with oreganos and their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K6v-z3cI-xRF-xREBu8vwQ.text: I'm only giving 4 stars not 5 because of the long wait for a table. Had family in town from Oregon and they wanted Italian food. We suggested Oregano's because it is a family friendly place with a great variety on the menu. We try to order different things and have yet to be disappointed! We love the gold wings and of course the pizza cookie!

-lNoScfzR6fRlwnAso2j4A.text: My Girlfriend and I love going to Oregano's. Not just because the food is amazingly delicious. It's because from the second you walk in the door you are greeted with a smile! Every time we have been there it seriously seams like the employees love there job!!!! The manager activity walks around the restaurant and checks on you to make sure you are doing well and helps out when needed. Such a great staff and environment. Never had a bad experience at Oregano's. The food comes out in such large portions and it's priced great! 5 stars for sure on this one and for anyone going there I would recommend that you try the - Alfredo The Dark and add chicken It is so amazing. Also for dessert you have to get the pizza cookie!!! Wonderful job to the staff keep up all the hard work and keep those smiles :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alfredo The Dark

fBK2Qgzj2-hiA_yrcP4KbA.text: Fan of Oregano's but will not hurry back to this location. Server gave poor service compared to the service she gave the other tables in the section. Fries were a bit over cooked, pasta had minimal sauce.   Appetizer was amazing. (Props to the kitchen on that) Seating was quick for a Saturday

Mi4v3Vy0O4YXnZGE5Q7slw.text: Stopped here for lunch for the first time ever with the hubby. Knew that it had to be good if a lunch crowd meant a wait for tables at 1pm. We sat at the bar and were greeted promptly by our server. Ordered from the lunch menu and ordered a pizza slice (pepperoni and portabella) and a side Caesar salad. Our food was brought out quickly. The "lunch" salad portion was huge enough for my husband and I to share. Pizza had the right amount of sauce and the crust was the correct thickness for my liking (thin and crisp!) Our total bill for lunch with drinks plus tip was under $30. The meal was very satisfying and we'd definitely come back!

j1wVvqK-CMmFXmC9xZ7Jtg.text: Ordered a lasagna to-go and while the flavor was definitely there, the size and pasta definitely was not (tasted like more meat and marinara than pasta/cheese). In fact I was still hungry after finishing--something that never happens when I eat lasagna!  Their saving grace is the thin crust pizza which is amazing and the chicken Caesar salad. I'll come back for those items.   Beware: The wait for a table can be long--we're talking a full hour on a Wednesday night. Best solution is to order to-go.

9pruSKY4QpdIVqEM6y6CGA.text: Our waiter was awesome! He was sooo flamboyantly fun and colorful! I got the chicken alfredo and it was so creamy and sexy. The chicken is kind of weird though as it's shredded and chewy. It's almost like dog food. Let me tell you about the cocktails though!!! They are sooooo good! I had the ginger beer one and it was soooo bomb! You have to get that! Then I had the root beer cocktail thing and it was sooo good! Nice and strong and the flavor was amazing ! Oh the bruschetta is forgettable so don't even order that. Plus they forgot to give it to us and we had to remind them after our meal arrived  They said their pizzas take an hour to cook so I passed on that. I recommend coming here for the cocktails. The food is mediocre in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ginger beer cocktail thing was sooo good

pseBCNDU6_sljyVypTVKpw.text: I love love the food but after we were seated, it took 15 minutes to get someone to serve us after I went up and asked if we had a server. Notnsiormer vusy and has some empty tables maybe short staffed but with a hungry kid 15 minutes waiting for water and a chance to order is way too long.

FF60Mad4dxeOpZlj-G4hzQ.text: Oreganos is always amazing from there appetizers the Bruschetta and cheese bread was awesome to there pizza and salads!  This time it was exceptional because not only was our food awesome but so was our service!  Autumn was so on top of everything from getting drinks, bringing us extra napkins to our food hot!  We had a party of 10 and kids were with us she asked if we wanted their food before ours,  she was just great!  Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants Chicago style food because you'll get it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eating out with the kids at Oreganos!

zZDWt5P9rAk_9KE1ZKKPMg.text: I recently went to this place for the very first time.  It was really disappointing.  I had the chicken lasagna.  Very, very little chicken (and I really looked for it -- a small piece here or there).  Not even tasting it at all.  It was also a pretty small portion for the price.  The most egregious problem of all was that the pasta was chewy.(!)   I actually had to take a piece out of my mouth and lay it aside, it was so hard to chew.  The whole bottom layer of the lasagna was inedible - could not cut it with my fork even!  That's pretty bad for a pasta place.  On the plus side, the people who work there are great - very friendly and responsive (only reason I didn't rate it a one star).  If I do go back, I will be certain to avoid the lasagna, but I seriously doubt I will go back.  I will go back to Olive Garden - their lasagna isn't 'chewy'.

t4JJEjBwPinJtCO4X06nug.text: Food is great as always . Hot Wings are super spicy but the sauce is delicious...  we got the a small salad and share fir two . Portions are great pretty big.  Service was slower than usual but they were busy and she was still great. Very friend and attentive..

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SYqYcwl5kSu4iJi8MXDU8Q.text: I personally really like this place, although the last couple of times we have gone it hasn't been as good. Not sure what's going on but still giving at four stars based on previous experiences. At any sort of popular time, the place is packed.

7FY4Qhxw8a4-a6H8FuUb9g.text: Oregano's never disappoints, no matter which location I visit. I personally prefer this PV location bc it's less than 2 miles from my house and it's where Richard is the bartender! Over the past couple years I've been coming here he's been so friendly, remembers my name, what I like to eat and drink, and provides the hospitality that Oregano's is famous for.  He has other regulars who visit him as well. Food's always delicious, too! Hot items always come out hot, cold items nice and fresh. I never sit at a table so I can't comment on that experience but the service I receive at the bar is always spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta and a Bellini. My happy place

Bhj-41FqEgQwsyhx98vZQw.text: I had the lasagna it was cold and the noddles tasted it was from a box. This is first time be disappointed with Oregano's.

AQiMQyyL1xdY5zfKF9YqgQ.text: The food is tasty and savory but what I didn't like is that unless you order from the lunch menu you cannot order a side salad( ridiculous rule) and for the prices they charge the restaurant should include complimentary bread, so instead I had to put in an order for bread which I'll be charged for. Other than that everything else was great and actually their marinara sauce is really goood and they sell it.

aT2Dz6mOQt_27D9BFauQZA.text: Was checking through Yelp as to what time the restaurant closed and noticed that it listed a wait time and gave me an option to use "Nowait wait list" so I tried it and was impressed  that we did not have to wait as we arrived.  Started off as we sat down by ordering the 12" stuffed pizza with Sausage and Pepperoni as was told it would take 45 to 50 minutes.  Also ordered Pene Pasta which came with a good slice of Italian Bread.  Finally ordered deep fried zucchini.   After reading the Azcentral review that listed as one of the best deep dish or stuffed pizza and oregano was listed, had to try it. Was totally in disagreement to this stuffed pizza being top five. Pizza was very wet and soggy and on top of that did not taste very much if any sausage or pepperoni. The outer crust was not bad but it was just too soggy with alot of tomato sauce and cheese which is not a good combination for my stomach.   The pasta was ordered with butter and that is what we got because my daughter had her 4 wisdom teeth removed 5 days prior. The deep fried zucchini was also not the best I have had and borderlined being frozen not fresh tasting.   Overall was very disappointed and l would not recommended the stuffed pizza as azcentral did

NbYrStd7GDvvrp-xEE_6bQ.text: We usually love oregano's. This location is disappointing though. Not only is the service extremely slow, the food was bad too. The pizza we ordered was not good and my kid refused to eat the Mac and cheese because it tasted bad to him. Even the pizza cookie Desert was not good, the cookie was not baked well. I have been to oregano's many times through the years and this was my first bad experience. So I do not recommend the paradise Valley location.

pdJXLsnn6JMnKShW7_pHFg.text: Will never come back to this location again. Terrible service. Starters took 45 mins to arrive and the main course was served within couple of mins of serving the starters....Looks like the waitress forgot about the starters, though she never acknowledged...it was Bruschetta and it should not take 45 mins..no, the restaurant was not jam packed. Also the pizza we ordered was ok and not the usual taste..something has changed at this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta. Took 45 mins to get this starter ! Baked bread with tomatoes, basil and cheese on top of it.

gHRmcAOZvrOmbFaXazvKmQ.text: Need to visit this place more often, food was so yummy! Julie took care of us and suggested a few items of which we ordered. We started with the Pesto Bruschetta and it was delish! The bread soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Next we shared the Oregano's Favorite salad. I would come back just to eat this salad, it was HUGE. The tomato and olives brought out a refreshing flavor to the salad and complimented the light dressing. And last we shared the Clark Street pizza. Just enough kick to it with the spicy meat and pepper flakes. EVERYTHING we ordered was amazing. Will definitely return to try other items on their menu.

ygTQnpbMcKgmK2FvWK2eXA.text: We loved the food and loved our waitress BUT this whole "Live Wait Time" feature on Yelp is not at all accurate and severely out of sync with the restaurant. And let me help out here, Join The Waitlist it is NOT a reservation. It simply puts you "at the top of the list" (whatever that means). Long story short, we had a party of 8 and the live wait time was 15-30 minutes so we checked in thinking that by the time we got there, we wouldnt have to wait too long seeing that we gave Oreganos a head up - figuring this was the whole point of the waitlist. Why did we wait an hour and a half after getting there?! There were ZERO people waiting when we got there so I'm not sure why it essentially took 1 hour 45 minutes to seat us (from when we checked in through Yelp to when we were actually seated). I suggest you call before going to find out the actual wait time and completely ignore the Live Wait Time feature on Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7EYhGmYgMz7vZOP8LTlHAQ.text: Oregano's asked that I contact them via email. I have done so, and I have not heard from them yet, I will keep you posted.

HPpyK_HRkeRN1K4UOi3EjQ.text: Great food, wonderful service... our waitress NINA was amazing... very kind and attentive. Great experience :)

oqg4SdOE4KB37SB51JtPgQ.text: Usually love Oreganos, but dang if tonight didn't disappoint!!!  We ordered for takeout (recognizing it's a Friday night, so expected it to take awhile).  Ordered the Oregano's Classic salad w chicken, an order of golden wings extra crispy, and Brussels sprouts.  Let me just say, the Brussels sprouts are the only redeeming part of this meal...the wings are not only not extra crispy, they are literally cold and soggy.  Blech.  The salad is also not good, the lettuce is wilted and black on the edges...it's basically inedible.  The Brussels are great, however!  I think the issue w the wings is that, when we arrived to pick it up, they were already done but were "waiting on the salad"...which took 20 more minutes!  Not sure why the salad was prepared after the wings, but having them sit in a plastic takeout container while a salad was prepared, didn't probably do them any justice.  I hate giving bad reviews, I really do...especially to places I normally love...but this was disappointing tonight...so much so that I've ordered a salad and wings from another restaurant.  Eek!

b6ztnN00ypoXAltMtqGdnQ.text: Today was our first time at this location. Service was fantastic (Kelsey was our server) .The food was fresh and tasted delicious. Management is doing a great job at this location. We enjoyed everything about our Oregano's experience !!: We definitely will be back.

KoBaLlDjsxFKrjvMdMqi3A.text: We love this place as a family! I would say we come here several times a month, and for the most part always receive amazing service, especially from Amina, whom our daughter adores! There are so many great things, so we switch it up often. We love the bellinis with extra Chianti (trust me, it's a good choice!), cheese garlic bread, big rig pasta (perfect amount of heat in the sauce, and the meatball sub with the waffle fries! The pizza is always a safe bet too, and we love the meatballs or sausage with pepperoni!! Can't go wrong here, and portions are crazy large. If you can stomach a pizza cookie at the end of your meal, it's well worth the $5!

YZqfcSjtJ0mVUhupPf7vtA.text: For most of my visits I'd rate this location as a 3-4. The wait times are fairly long and the wait staff are hit or miss but the food is always solid. And the portions are crazy.  We went for my dad's birthday tonight and it was a bit of a disaster. We had a party of 7 with 4 people over the age of 60. We waited an hour and were seated in the back of the patio. It was 99 degrees at that hour and we were seated where there were no misters. We asked if we could be reseated inside or in the main part of the patio. The woman who was the manager told us we'd have to wait for 90 mins for either. She claimed there was a party of 15 that was waiting ahead of us. As it turns out, that was a party of 10 and they showed up an hour after we did. After unnecessary back and forth, they moved the not so powerful portable AC in our direction so we stayed.  The food, as usual, was solid but the service was bad. Our waitress dropped multiple comments throughout our dinner about how other guests under the covered patio with misters were annoyed that the direction of the portable AC changed. She didn't come check on us very much so we had empty water glasses for a lot of the night.   Overall, the way they dealt with the seating was unprofessional and difficult. This could have been avoided if they had asked us if we were ok with being seated in that part of the patio prior to placing us there. I don't think I'll be back here any time soon.

oz1YF4rJZmdrlB_PuDe0kQ.text: Love the cauliflower crust! It is the bomb! Always delicious and consistent at any location. Super nice girl working the line. Happy as always! Cauliflower crust, pesto, mozzarella, feta, garlic, spinach, onions and chicken!

UZoJPlclaHckN_fac3fYXw.text: Oreganos thin and deep dish pizza is so good! I have recently tried the competition (Giordano's), and in my opinion Oregano's is the clear cut champ in the pizza battle. The additional menu items are so also fantastic, salads, pasta, desserts, you name it and Oregano's has it dialed in.

_ECXHe74q3MxNIN_aaHJlw.text: Definitely one of our favorites! Love Oregano's Favorite salad and Brooklyn loves Zany Ziti!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pFdVJ-yIPMI1nNK7ou2CAg.text: This review is long overdue.  I last visited Oregano's 3 years ago.  I spent 2 weeks in Phoenix in 2016.  I visited many restaurants in that time (from quick places like in & out to big fancy steakhouses to trendy hot spots downtown).  And nobody impressed me more than Oregano's.  Service was friendly and on point both times I came.  The food was remarkably delicious and prices were very reasonable.   I'm a bartender in D.C. and to this day, when I hear of someone visiting Phoenix, I always recommend Oregano's.  Also when someone mentions they're from Phoenix, I mention Oregano's and their eyes light up.  So I know I'm not the only one that feels this way about them.  Keep up the good work and I look forward to one day returning to one of your establishments.

BxOV2JeU7ihgLxtiHFW1zg.text: Had the O-reva pizza! I recently went to Italy and this crust is the closest I have had since being back. It was very good. Passion fruit tea was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yep! It was good!!!

82t6yI4WyvXcIjPcEl9ajw.text: Horrible place. Went here the other night on a Tuesday around 7 pm and they said it would be a 20 minute wait and it was over an hour. When we finally got our take it took forever to get the food. My mom s salad had some sort of hair out string in it and my dad's dinner was wrong.     Not sure of this I'd the norm for this place but we are never going back

Ez99Ke-egI1XvRV02ATJUw.text: We had their Margherita pizza . It looked and tasted like frozen pizza. Otherwise the service was good and our food came up quickly.

vcZmX1v1tgBeo7YgvY-klA.text: My daughter and I thought we would try a new pizza establishment this evening and ended up at Oregano's.  We couldn't have made a better decision!  First, we were greeted by staff outside as they opened the door and welcomed us in.  The bar is in the front but not loud or rowdy and no smoking (a BIG plus!).  Though a Sat. eve, we were seated in a timely manner, after being given a choice of seat locations.  Our waitress promptly arrived and filled our drink order, then advised her shift was over and Juan B. would take care of us the remainder of our stay.  Juan stopped by our table quickly, answering questions about the menu and making small talk.  He allowed us a couple more minutes to decide as he attended other patrons.  After placing our order, Juan made sure to let us know one of the dishes we ordered would take 30-min. so we didn't think they forgot us.  He stopped by our table a couple of times prior to our meal arriving to refill our glasses and see if we needed anything.  The food was warm/hot upon arrival and very tasty.  The portions were enough for 2-4 people so naturally we boxed the remainder to take home.  Throughout, Juan was attentive, pleasant and made our visit even that much more enjoyable.  It is rare to visit any establishment nowadays where the customer is made to feel welcome and appreciated, the food is good and prices reasonable.  I think Oregano's is our new go-to place for a meal out and always, we will ask for Juan!

EglPBmzuyKatFKfBSIOv0A.text: I'm from the Pacific Northwest but my family frequently visits the Phoenix area. Every time we do, we stop into an Oregano's (the ones on Cactus and Camelback, in particular). We have never had a truly negative experience: the only complaint I've ever had was slow service, and that was due to how busy the restaurant was at that time. The food is always fantastic. The Bollo Pasta is HUGE (even though it's unlimited, you won't need more than one order!) and really yummy. I also love the Pasta Basta with sausage. The sausage is super spicy and flavorful, and the skin gets nice and crispy. It's AMAZING. Speaking of sausage, I'd also recommend the Famous Chicago Italian Sausage sandwich... the provolone helps tame the spiciness of the sausage, making it a great combination. And, of course you can't go wrong with the pizza. Perfect proportion of crust to toppings. As for the atmosphere, it is so much fun! The vintage decor is awesome, the waitstaff is very friendly, and the restaurants are always lively. If you haven't tried Oregano's yet, you have to give it a try! The long wait is definitely worth it.

TUv3M1j5r68SB1fnKFJLfg.text: This restaurant was located down Channing Tatum and right on his Cactus blvd........hahahha.  That was the joke for us out-of-towners that day.  Anyhow, the pizza here was great.  We had to wait outside since there was a long wait at the time and one of the employees came out to give samples in the 100 degree weather.  When we tried the samples we already knew that this place was serious.  Definitely worth the wait and if you want to avoid the lines I would recommend calling in and taking it to go since there were a lot of patrons going that route as it seemed.

RGyTpt78d77fPxNLqNmpJQ.text: I went here on Saturday with some of my girlfriends and as usual the food was excellent. Surprisingly this one by PV mall did not have a wait on Saturday afternoon. Usually I try and avoid Oregano's due to the wait. But if you can get in without waiting an hour it is definitely worth a stop.  My favorite here is the thin crust chicken and pineapple pizza. It might not sound awesome but it is! You should give it a try

CSINsnHuSzpf_5EQqJR9BA.text: Went here a couple of weeks ago and got take out. My big rig pasta was missing it's garlic bread and the pasta was over cooked and mushy. My fiance's beef sandwich was missing it's cole slaw. I've gone to this restaurant to eat as well in the recent past and felt the service was crappy and the food was mediocre. Think I'm done giving this establishment my money.. Recommend you find a different, less crowded, less loud and less over priced Italian restaurant. Unless you like not being able to hear each other talk and having crappy services plus a high bill, by all means.

7Eat2kLzuv-vzNWZiGMfcg.text: Been here a couple times now and the pizza is sooo good. Thankfully they serve lodi wines. Had to get the michael David seven deadly glass.  We ordered the combination pizza. Delish!!!! We will be back again soon. Great place to stop into on the way to Scottsdale from the airport.

WdA2gDwyK2LVlX-oNI8Qlg.text: I've been here a few times and enjoy it, however I do a few things differently than many of the other reviewers and that's probably why I have little to no complaints.  One, I usually go during the off hours. It might get crowded while I'm there, but my family and I rarely have to wait to be seated.  Two, we basically order the same things over and over, which is why we only go there when we're craving something specific. Oddly enough, it's not their pizza. Oregano's has some great pastas, meatball subs, and chicken wings.   Their services ranges from lacking to pretty good. I haven't had anyone yet that was horrible, the worst was just negligent and had to be flagged down for refills or extra napkins, but she wasn't rude or anything like that. I enjoy it overall, but probably because I don't actually eat the pizza as the few times I did I found it decent, but not worth the price. I do recommend it, but not for the reasons most people would probably go to it for.

N4FAbq1UggQGc35PugLAfA.text: Quality food, the Pablo Picasso salad is great and the pizza is fantastic.  There is no rhyme or reason as to the timing of bringing out food or drinks but you don't come here for great service just good food for the price point.

O8gIyWNf_xU0noMtPCVZ6A.text: Italian gold wings are crack!  Food is slow.

HvU0l--1Rhs66fbGpSiZ1A.text: Had to write an update....  We went here last night, my third visit, and the dish "Alfredo The Dark" is just awful.  I ordered it with chicken and the chicken comes shredded and piled on top.  The dish is made with spiral pasta, poblano peppers, of which I could find none, southwestern cheeses, tomatoes and jalapenos (neither of which I had come with the dish) and the whole conglomeration was just awful.  The flavor was just not good, especially with the shredded chicken.  I thought maybe it would be better warmed up for lunch today but I was wrong.  This dish misses the mark and I won't be ordering it again.    This place still gets 4 stars because their thin crust pizza is to-die-for.  We had sausage, pepperoni and extra cheese and it is one of my favorites around town!

Wdp9CyTL5Rd2q6QQ1KB4bw.text: The food at Oreganos has never failed to be amazing. Wait times, are long, but it's always been my experience that the quality of the food being served is very high.  The service, I find, is hit or miss, depending on the luck of the draw, which it typical in any restaurant given the server that is assigned to the table at which uou were seated   Overall, I think the atmosphere is fun and most everyone is having a good time

m7O0r_21-FN16hs8l3NtzQ.text: You can't go wrong with a place that serves a half-baked cookie with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Just sayin. But that's not all we got. We came here for my mom's b-day and it was my husband and 1 year old son too. They were very accommodating for my son who is in a high chair. We had bruschetta, which is great if you like lots of garlic. We also got the pesto ziti, which was kind of lacking in flavor. Needed more basil or salt or something. Also got the spinach salad which was huge and delicious and perfect. The Italiano lasagna could have used more beef for me; it seemed to be too heavily overweighted in cheese. The service was outstanding, and we got a free pizzookie for my mom's birthday. MMMMM.

5JFRMUhwfQ5Sf0OsSse-pQ.text: I've been back twice since my original review and I wanted to say that this wasn't a fluke. I've gotten (split with someone) the meatball sub each time and split a salad.  Each one is better, and seemingly bigger, than the next!  If you have dinner plans, I wouldn't eat lunch here!  Can't wait to try the pizza!

2MCy0gCYiCZg_SSgGCD_jQ.text: I went to Oreganos Scottsdale location and ordered spaghetti a while ago. I could not eat it. I found out why they are called Oreganos. There was so much in the sauce I had to send it back. I finally decided to give oreganos another chance. This time I went to the Cactus location in PV. I went with my boyfriend. We wanted a pan pizza. First, you have to order separate ingredients. You can't get one of the combo pizzas. Then we were told it would be 45 mins to an hour. Maybe they should offer complimentary basket of crust and marinara while you wait. We left. So I can't say anything about the pizza.

kMUPfkDUt573HVjoIEi8Iw.text: it's a 4.5 star place.  really good casual italian place. salads are pretty much can't miss, and i love the clark street pizza.  but for something in this space, it needs the "you MUST try" dish to get five stars. while almost everything on the menu is really good, there's nothing life-changing about it.

qt_2_kmJi4hTJGQvMlkH-w.text: Love their food and the service at this location is always awesome! Yes, it can get insanely busy. That's because the food is great. It is now a Pepsi place again (I love that!!) My favorites include boom dip and wings. It's also kid-friendly with good prices & quick food. One more thing: they give kids some dough to entertain them

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepsi place again...makes me very, very happy

rB9IOniLoDL75L_kmVvjhg.text: Ordered takeout, the pan pizza only had the flavor of Oregano. I won't order the pizza again. The pasta was a tasty very large portion, the staff friendly and prices affordable.

cd005Sg8aJWu8-nS6LFAfQ.text: Always a great gathering place with the best pizza and servers in Arizona!  Always personable and talk about a salad that is a starter will take it over the top Give it a try you will be a regular!!!

QN-l3N1MBdIgukP-niqNtg.text: I love Oreganos ... went to the PV location because I was in the area. Morgan was my server. She was super friendly, suggested the big rig with chicken for me and my friend. It was delicious. She had drinks come fast, kept our waters full and always had a smile on. I will be coming back more to this location if any of the servers are as friendly and efficient as her. As always, oreganos food is good and always hits the spot.

x5UBn35yZm3olf5AIxKwUA.text: Frequent diner at all Oreganos throughout the valley... Was a "regular" at the original local and always have loved their food and for a period was my favorite place to go for a salad. Over a period of a few years (not specific) the quality of the salads has gone WAY down.... This was my experience again today. Where is the actual lettuce? I am eating the chunks at the bottom of a head of lettuce and more "wilty" lettuce than anything. People actually want the green leaves that make up a head of lettuce. I had a side salad and my friend had a Caesar salad. The only difference was the dressing and mine had 2 sad looking tomato slices. The rest of the food was and always has been great, but time for ownership/management to step it up on the salads.

9hP7rM3TVjub1WwgalIgIw.text: This place deserves way better ratings. The food is amazing!!!! Yeah it may take a while but have some patience going out people!!!!!! The kitchens in these places aren't the biggest and they are always packed so expect to wait! It's worth it. The Guacamole appetizer, mama Mia Mexican salad, & steak salad are the best!!! Gotta finish with a pizzookie !! :)

AFSjCQVMMaV4XT6bLxXHpg.text: Always, always, always love this place. Quality ingredients, great prices, and spice! Usually order the El Diablo Shrimp Pasta because I love the spicy sauce and the shrimp are bigger and tastier, not like chains... and The Big Beef Sandwich - THE BEST. Finally tried the Guaca-Tony YUM!  My favorite casual dining restaurant in the valley because of the combination of quality and value. Simply the best. Thank you Oregano's!

raw-BFs4se5usxc-Oqa8LQ.text: This is the newest in the Oregano's chain.  If someone didn't tell you it was on Cactus at the PV Mall you'd swear you were in any of their other locations. This place gets packed! A relatively early dinner (5:30) on a Friday night required a 20 minute wait for a table.  Not bad, but plan ahead.  The service is outstanding.  They have the happiest employees I've seen in a restaurant.  Seriously, these people could work at Disneyland.  Our party of six had thin crust pizza, a junior meatball sandwich, the baked zitti, rigatoni and angel hair pasta.  We also shared a fried calamari appetizer. The calamari was very good.  It's battered, then baked, then pan fried in garlic butter.  Served with marinara sauce.   Two of us shared a pizza.  It was OK but a bit oily for my liking.  Maybe the deep dish or pan pizza would have been a better choice. All of the pasta dishes were excellent. The junior meatball sandwich was pretty big and comes with fries.  You might want to think twice before you order the full sandwich.  They only have one dessert choice here - they only need one dessert choice here!  The Original Pizza Cookie is available in chocolate chip or white chocolate macadamia nut.  We ordered both and shared.  DAMN! Half cooked cookie dough and ice cream - who knew it was so good?  Did I mention the service?  Will we be back - yep!

-1Qg4vSPvqt9Vzvv94jj-g.text: Some of the best most personable service staff my Wife and I have met.   The people are great here and the food completes the experience.  We've never had to wait longer than 30 min for a seat and the food is worth it. If you have to wait on a Friday or Saturday night grab yourself a drink or help yourself to the complimentary thin crust pizza they hand out.   You won't be disappointed with this establishment, they have a recipe for their food and customer service and it works.

3gjxw8oRRXkm8e8dVxwNbQ.text: I'm only giving this place one star because my dinner salad was pretty good (italian dressing had big chunks of tomato in it, which was strange), and my chicken parm sandwich was somewhat ok... The thin crust pizza was below average- absolutely no seasoning- just beyond boring blah pizza. Not good. The service was ok... And I'm being nice.  This was our first and last time here. I have no idea what all the hype is about this place- not impressed.

W8_C9Ec8qylU996Y8Cf6XQ.text: This place has great deep dish pizza and really huge salads. I love to go here for cocktails too. Deep dish takes a bit of time so get there a little earlier than you plan on eating.  It can also get pretty packed so be prepared.

deTEzRdK0VZHIa8_ArRWxQ.text: Had a nice dinner . Enjoyed our server Amina . She is fun and upbeat !!!  Thanks Amina

7m9QCXIuwZ8lX43oafkk8Q.text: How any Oregano's location has only 3.5 stars is beyond me. We have NEVER had a bad experience at an oregano's. The food is always delicious and the portions are huge! The service is always very friendly and on the ball. They have great specialty drinks and a small but good selection of beer in draft. Some of the food can take a while to cook, but the server has always warned us if we ordered one of these dishes.  You won't be disappointed with what you order at Oregano's. I tend to favor the diablo shrimp pasta and any of the pizzas. Seriously, any of them.   Save room for the pizza cookie! it truly is the best one out of all the other fakes that try and make it.

chIE1xmleXT5NwH3ZuuWNQ.text: Great food but awful service by our waitress while five staff stood up in a corner and chatted for over one hour. Is there a manager somewhere??

hxktFqbRk0YF-WSp-bNfcA.text: I love this location. Every server we have gotten at this location the service has been fantastic. Always get are orders right.

Lsk1gv5vETDiDdmafp-7fA.text: You know... I raved about this place weeks ago and came back today... And I just couldn't be unhappier. Service was slow and the bartenders walked by several times and didn't even ask how we're doing or if we needed anything... It took forever to get the check and even longer to get the box. We ordered some garlic cheese bread and it came out with the rest of the food we ordered instead of just an appetizer... We ordered a caesar salad and at first they sent the wrong one and we had no idea.. We wondered why it tasted so weird but then the staff (all three waiters) just stood there and stared at us eating it since it was the wrong one like we were criminals or something. My friend asked what was wrong and they said we had the wrong salad... As if it was our fault they brought it out to us. The wings we ordered were cold and hard which is why we even came back here again tonight. I will not be back at this location ever.

DCxytzy2znllK5-w5uWLrQ.text: We always noticed the long lines to get in this place. We ate here tonight and realized the wait was because the restaurant is small and it takes forever to get your food. The food was good but not great. Not sure we will come back

Tgmc27HBd0kq4yx893U20w.text: Worse pizza I have ever had.....pizza was so dry n I asked for extra sauce....I didn't say no sauce !!!  Just awful.....crust so thin my crackers at home had more body than their crust.....this place has gone downhill for pizza.......won't ever be going back there at all !  Its certainly no big deal......not after tonight....

VmKG6c15XCanBsdr3pYFeQ.text: I absolutely love Oregano's! On this particular visit, we ordered the Pablo Picasso Mexico Salad and the Sproccoli pizza. The salad was amazing and full of flavor. The pizza was delicious as well, but not one of my favorites. As usual, I recommend any Oregano's location.

gcKLqIBBbjkHzd6DM63syw.text: Great service and great food! Not a fan of Italian food, but love the unique flavors.   It also seems like this place is always busy. That's always a great sign.

6TSVQz-cAOIf_rAdsF5Zeg.text: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere,  great service, excellent food!! We ordered the Clark street meat and Grandma Gs potato pizza. It was fabulous!! The sauteed onions were the perfect compliment to the pizza! I definitely recommend this place to anyone. We came with four kids, and they weren't a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza!

RBDg-ok7fPfUUlEKaopY0A.text: What can I say? It was weird. For starters our appetizer came out before our drinks. The cheesy garlic bread was very delicious. The menu was all over the place. From guacamole to chicken wings. But it all tasted fine.   The main issue was the timing of everything. It was an hour and fifteen before the main dishes came. They ran out of cups and brought our refills in paper cups but the straws were plentiful.   Very weird smell in the hallway towards the bathroom.   The homemade ice cream at the end was wonderful, not to be upstaged by the warm cookie.   Our meal ended with the waitress dumping copious amounts of fortune cookies onto the table out of a plastic bag. Fortune cookies. At an Italian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EZCTsuO2nOVOFpUo5jnxIQ.text: Had the big rig pasta at my first time at Oregano's and it was great! Customer service was terrific and they have a cool restaurant setup! Definitely would recommend to any one looking to grab lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IPz0R0mpTveIORp8nVLdJg.text: The saddest thing has happened... this place went to crap!  We used to come here weekly and now won't be back... Service is slow but the real issue is the menu change... they have removed everything that we used to eat... significant downsizing over the last couple years... ohhhhh... and they increased all the prices and made the wait times longer... soggy pan pizza... only 9 total wings for 3 dollars more... and every order the last 3 times has been messed up........ good job Oreganos!

qwDb1KzyJEU_DhEbI9M7TQ.text: Great pizza bistro, but plan on waiting during weekend dinner times there is usually a high volume of people and they do not take reservations. Several locations around the valley. They offer indoor and out door seating with vibrant atmosphere and music. Take advantage of their lunchtime specials. All portions are large with moderate pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The famous Pazookie. Highly recommended to splurge and save room for!
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach artichoke appetizer- super yummy and a great start to any meal!
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oregano&#39;s pizza menu

IM3enEd0VkINlfB9ZNWvPw.text: I really don't like giving low reviews but this place is just... not good. And the service is sloooooooooooooow.   On this dinner visit we walked in and were promptly seated. Our waitress greeted us after a couple of minutes and was super friendly. We already knew what we wanted to order and she advised me the o'zone takes about 20 minutes. I was cool with that so we proceeded with our order. Then it all kind of went downhill. We waited much much longer than 20 minutes. Tables came and left in the time it took for us to receive our meal and pay quickly after.   Our waitress was doing the best she could. She was constantly running from table to table and did check in on us, thanking us for our patience. She was clearly texting her best but it was a pretty steady night. The thing is, every time I've been dragged in here it's been the same situation.   The reason this review goes to a two.. the food. It's not even that good. I'm sorry, I've tried to like it, I really have, but it's all pretty blah and never sits well with me either. With many other chain Italian restaurants around, this place just doesn't stand out.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. O&#39;zone

CkWfZ1txFFXIqXthjGLCKw.text: First time trying this place and it didn't really start off impressing me. I got here around noon and was sealed immediately on the porch area. Our waiter came around pretty quickly and took our drink order. Since this was our first time trying this place out, we needed a few minutes to look over the menu.   I decided on the Zany Ziti which is ziti in a bread bowl. The pasta was delicious, however I wouldn't suggest trying to eat the bread bowl as it was really hard, dry, and had no taste to it so I ended up not eating any of it. The Zany Ziti came with a slice of garlic bread which was soft and seasoned well.   My reason for giving this place a 3 star is because of the long wait from when we were seated to when our food came out. We got here right before the big rush came and we still waited 45 minutes for our food. Was about to ask where it was when they finally brought it out. Large groups that came after I did got their food way before my food, so obviously food wasn't brought out in the order that they were placed.   Our waiter was very pleasant and very knowledgeable of the menu. He came around often to check up on us, to refill drinks, make sure food was how we liked it, etc. When it came to pay, he was quick to bring our check and cash us out.   Will come back again, but probably try and come during the week so not to get caught up in the weekend rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zany Ziti

ans6nwI7-Nx2OTDSMbla3w.text: Oreganos is a local Italian chain here in Arizona that does simple Italian extra big. From pasta to sandwiches, wings and salads Oreganos offers something for everyone, providing you have an appetite.  While the service is always solid, and the food is great be aware that whether you are coming on a date, or a business party, there is going to be a wait at most times of the day. Also be prepared for a loud interior atmosphere.  As for the food, i've yet to be disappointed. I would go out of my way to recommend the Wings and The Stuffed Mushrooms however. Like getting seated, their pizzas take time, but they are also humungous like everything else. Great for feeding a large group with an appetizer or large salad on the side.  This is a great place to come beat the AZ heat, but it has it's quirks when it comes to wait time and serving size. While they don't deliver themselves they are an awesome place to get something picked up by Uber Eats or to come grab yourself on your way home for a nice hot and filling meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a9aM0XZL2VRVyseQv5WT0g.text: In spite of reading previous negative reviews, we decided to give Oregano's a try.   Sat at the bar to avoid a 30 min wait.   The lunchtime meal was excellent:   Thin crust pizza, angel hair spaghetti with a meatball and garlic bread.   The food was delicious, the server attentive and wait times not bad.   Can't say for other times of day, but our lunchtime experience was two thumbs up

bAYNnPuE6YaCM31Qlpdpmw.text: We had been here tonight for dinner. It was a very good decision. We ordered half n half of Bistro Classic and Pesto Sauce pizza, Big RigPasta and French fries for the sides . Pizza was too yummy and truly Italian. Pasta was the king of the meal. Ambience was perfect for a summer night The service was too gud.

A4rud1GiU3f2J9ny6e2fSA.text: Was not the best salad I've had there. Better in my opinion at the Shea location ... service was good as usual ... little absent minded waitress but it was busy .

pWZo-xxA9267c-UZIoLHRw.text: I love this location! I'm not one to post on this yelp thing but my wife and I have always received great service here especially when we get kelsie! She always greets us with kindness and gives us the best service! She always brings us our food on great timing and I was also pleased when her manager Garnet had went out of her way to ask us how we were doing & how was our food. Greatest service we've ever gotten and we can't wait to come back!

uKwAtI7ue_P8shf4VIknIg.text: Love it here! The food is amazing, my favorite thing is the Pablo Picasso salad. We normally try to sit with Kelsie at the bar or at a table, she's the best and so fun!

eyGm6uUT_BoD-qE4sf1rcw.text: Finally got something I liked after my third visit in the past 2-3 months.  Meatball sandwich. Good desserts and drinks. Not huge fan of

sY2RpGtu7ZFiZjbOYw0nIQ.text: Kristen provided the best service possible. The food was great. Had pizza thin crust, perfect.  Our service was timely and on time. Kept drinks full. We will ask for her section every time . Beef salad was great

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great time

Pv7-K_zhaXptWIsaqdGcpA.text: Love love the desert ! Heaven in my mouth, both me and my boyfriend were shocked at how soft the cookie was and it was delicious!! Though the food is rather cheap, I did not enjoy it. I had the riti pasta and felt as if it was too dry. The cheesy bread was good though !

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pazoockie

QBfKBo2WxfTzTrQBoaLAWg.text: We came on a busy Saturday evening. We were seated right away and our food was very promt. Everything was fresh, hot and delicious!  Our server was on top of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Rig pasta was a great meatless meal option.

HJIz-3Rf9y4Hb_YTtWYZJw.text: My friend took me to Oregano's for the first time while I was visiting Arizona this past weekend. Oregano's has not only great food but such a fun atmosphere, and such friendly service!! Our bartenders Kristen and Juan were awesome and made sure we tried the best house cocktails, and then recommended a chips and guac sort of appetizer but with pizza crust! A bread lovers dream.  Also, make sure you get the cookie/ice cream dessert!!  Thank you Oregano's, Juan and Kristen, I will be back on my next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GHCKqXi8GAQr8j_7crDSoA.text: I've been to Oregano's many times before but this is my first time at the PV location. I went with my coworker during our lunch break and ordered The Turkey Stuffed sandwich and it tasted pretty horrible. The flavor of the turkey was odd and the potato chips were stale. I ate a few bites and that was that. The waitress seemed concerned but I simply didn't have time to send the food back or complain as I was on my lunch break. My coworker had a slice of pizza and a salad. She ate just a couple bites of the pizza and said it was horrible but she raved about her salad. We also shared a pizza cookie and it was ok. Overall we would pass on the food going forward but the waitress provided pretty good customer service which is why I'm giving this location 3 stars.

g6Lv4dW_83HlC9YfgjN3XA.text: Great, healthy Italian food.  Great staff. A pleasurable experience. We had the puta pizza, cannoli,  big bigoli and meatballs, and a half price bottle of wine on special.  Best tiramisu we've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xlrQEFrQKPNGbyIw1E1q1Q.text: I went there to eat with my family. Wasn't very impressed with the salad. My daughter got spaghetti and meatballs they were OK. The place wasn't very clean inside. And the bathrooms are a little dirty. I would maybe go back.

tsCy3qeorQW20QZTVZmoRA.text: Seriously my favorite restaurant in Maricopa County. Staff is always friendly & attentive. I have never had a bad experience here. I highly recommend the Big Rig or the Bowl O Pasta if you are wanting pasta, a deep dish pizza, the caesar salad, and obviously a pizza cookie (salted caramel is super yummy, but so is the original chocolate chip!)

ndf_aksLThQDLQFgdRRClw.text: I'm not a fan of Oreganos like everyone else. I have tried numerous menu items --recommended fan favorites and freestyling with my own selection -- and I always wind up disappointed. That said, one of my very favorite people loves this place and, what I think I finally figured out is, he orders the right thing (and it's not exactly "Italian"). So, from now on, when I go to Oregano's, I'm getting what he gets: Alfredo The Dark with chicken. I had been reluctant because I'm not a white sauce gal, but the sauce application is actually relatively light and the cheese is more pronounced. The poblano and southwestern cheese blend are what set this dish apart. ($8.99)   Of course, the pizookie is (almost) always a hit. They do need a few more minutes than they think in the new, faster ovens, though...

M05XApHHS0RFRJC17TPImw.text: I loved the place they have really good food. They burnt my pizza a little and gave another one for free. One of the best restaurants I have ever been to.

nfbu077P3tU4X72OmD-Bzw.text: The food here is worth every penny. It is cheap and yet huge and satisfying. If you dont like oreganos something is wrong with you.. It is so amazing that you go home and think about it.. I mean dream about it.. YUMMMMY! :)

XzIAqkduFsvwBdy0KrcwrQ.text: We are regulars at Oregano's.  Love the food, the staff is super friendly and always very accommodating.  We will to continue to go back again and again.

V1dhKK_xSjMYnn8CZu88Ag.text: The salads are huge and delicious.  I go to two different Oregano's, the waitstaff is always nice at both places. I honestly can't say more since I never order anything but salads.  Try one, you'll be pleased.

k35JcHzHaXwEAEEqan-TaQ.text: Place is always packed for weekend dinners, harder to get in if there's more than a party for two.  Giant portions, love that there's enough to share or to munch on the followinh day.    Cheese crisp and p'zookie are our motivation to come here, wish tables were not too close together, but I get it's part of their charm, plus that would mean less tables and then there  would be a longer wait ;)

sHABqnUFZKkFKicAtXWTcg.text: The delivered Pizza was not like what was pictured on Yelp, or as I had at the location downtown. The pepperoni and mushrooms were on top of the sauce and completely covered by cheese, instead of on top of the cheese, so the pepperoni was soggy, not crispy. Somewhere in the mush was an excessive amount of oregano. I would have sent this back if it hadn't been delivered. It was awful. I will never eat at this location again.

hdmgwNJm2hUwn5juX5TvpQ.text: We love Oregano's. We hate their wait times. Their stuffed pizza keeps us coming back, despite having to wait over an hour most times. While their regular stuffed pizza is good, their stuffed pizza using their Big Rig sauce (from their Big Rig pasta) in place of the normal pizza sauce makes it something you can't get anywhere else. It makes the pizza a little creamy and gives it a bit of a spicy kick. The server is always a little confused when we order it this way, but they always comment that it looks amazing when they bring it out. And it always is.   If you somehow have room left for dessert, their pizza cookies, slightly underdone, are the perfect way to end the meal.

_MQvRLCwkOD5-yLmLZ2A-w.text: I like oreganos. I like their food and pizza. I  comfortable bar and outside tables. It is not too loud, like you can hear person you want to talk. But is loud enough that other visitors couldn't eavesdrop your conversation. There is no smoking inside. Beer is pretty good as well. Prices are not bad, it usually cost me 20-30 dollars every time I go there. Oh yeah I love their Barbeque pizza  I think it is a good pass time place

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chicken pizza

b0QyrpJ-QMIeAHr8LItqOQ.text: We love the family favorite spot!! We are not big on waiting for tables so we intentionally jump to Oreganos when we are ready for "Linner!"  Love their Oreganos Favorite salad & love their Bellinis!!  Their staff is kind and helpful!!

tqeHi2XANdPLqjpEwdSHVw.text: Oreganos is always amazing....i can order just about anything on the menu and it will be fantastic!!! On a casual night i go for the deep dish.  It takes a while to cook but is well worth the wait.

mqGuvJqJgPm_TJSXLv_T9Q.text: I don't know why this oreganos gets a bad rap. They are always busy, every location is, but I usually pick up to go and it is always good. The staff is nice and I like how they pack the order in front of you so you never get home and realize something is missing. We usually get the wings which are killer, the beefstro salad that had amazing dressing and cheese bread with marinara. We do switch up the salad and sometimes get pizza, we are never dissapointed. At a busy time, say Friday night, expect a long wait for eat in or pick up, but I can't hate on them for that. They are busy for a reason!

bwzj2oeiPHyjggOYc92uSg.text: Jalen. Jalen. Jalen! What can I say about this guy? I understand it was a busy night, as I use to be in the service industry. At least check in with your guest. He was horrible! Didn't check in once with us until we flagged him down to refill our drinks, get a to go box and check. We even had to hand him our card to pay our bill because he didn't even pick it up. Unbelievable, he should not be working during the busy times. The food was good, but other then that, all downhill with our service. Definitely won't be coming back! :(

yBY4NoroKWxI6rB3Gnf4qQ.text: Pumpkin beer was great. Only reason I'm rating  them a 2 is  because they have no Wi-Fi! Get with it.

WcE7aitCN-8v_fsOvyU4oA.text: The wait is the only thing I hate. But it must be good food if you have to wait. We came in 8 deep and our waiter was nice and accommodating to my big loud family. We ordered sooo much food and I can everything was top notch.

JkPjL5C41lk6V5SheboImA.text: The Original Pizza Cookie!?  There's no better way to celebrate your birthday than a delicious 1/2 pound of chocolate chip, peanut butter chocolate, or white chocolate macadamia nut cookie dough baked a topped with three scoops of vanilla ice cream!  Well, there is, but only with Oregano's as a part of your special day (especially as it is FREE on your birthday).    Funny thing...I went to Oregano's last night and didn't even get the Original Pizza Cookie.  That is because I was filled up on a salad and pizza, both shared with a friend.  My friend and I enjoyed a delicious Pablo Picasso Mexico Salad (with chicken in it) though apparently then can substitute pinto beans for chicken for vegetarians.  If there's just two of you, get the Jr. instead of the full salad as it is already HUGE as a Jr.    We also ordered a pan pizza with several toppings.  We were warned that it would take 45-60 minutes for the pizza to come out and were pleased to see it show up in a half hour.  Delicious but quite filling pizza!  Made for great leftovers though.    I have also enjoyed thin crust pizzas and several of the bottomless pastas in the past.  While sometimes the wait times can be longer than other times, the estimated wait times are usually pretty accurate.  Parking at the Paradise Valley location is a breeze!  Definitely a pizza place that visitors to Phoenix should go to regardless of which location, as it is only an Arizona chain.

rrGqtz6OwgDffFXbc7fEcA.text: Love this place, good atmosphere, great food. Service is decent, wait is usually quite long though. Often worth the wait. There parking lot is too small and usually you have to walk across tot he mall parking lot.   Their lunch special is excellent and lots of food!!!

gz6BdUHRMZJhadXxsjiFSw.text: Oregano's is always a solid place to go for pizza, especially if you like your crust very thin as I do.   It's also great for kids. They're presented with a wad of pizza dough to keep them busy for what can be a pretty long wait for food. If you order the kids pizza, you can get them started eating ahead of the adults. For about $3, the kids can opt for a simple pepperoni, diamond cut, while the adults can select something more flavorful. For dessert a warm panned cookie with ice cream to share for just five bucks.  This location, in a building originally built to be a restaurant, is not as unique as some more creative converted locations, either a plus or a minus depending on your perspective. There is an outdoor patio with a very effective heating system if it's cold outside.   The only problem, really, is that wait times can be long. We arrived at 5:15 p.m. on a Wednesday and still couldn't be seated immediately. That's Oregano's, I guess.

jcxAGDKbOWOcSFi_5YF9Mg.text: Nice Italian atmosphere with oversized portions. Menu is extensive and there is a good wine list, too. I recommend the eggplant parmesan.

xp_HMf3f_R1VsWt5tOzYyQ.text: Every time I visit Arizona I have to stop here! Everything on the menu is good but I always stick to the great golden medium wings and Bellini.  If we move back this will be our go to place every week. The kids love playing with the dough ball and if you want they can throw it in the oven and the boys can eat it after you play with it!

vSH4gIf2NdURBdJYkRRXIA.text: Out of all the Oregano's I have visited in Arizona, unfortunately this one would rank at the bottom. I usually avoid this location because of previous disappointing visits however, I have family living nearby and I hadn't eaten all day so, my son and I stopped in for some pizza & wings. It was a couple of Saturdays back around 4pm. The place was crowded but, not slammed. Hence, no wait to get seated.  We ordered our usual thin pizza & buffalo wings. Wings came out rather quickly (15 minutes) and they were fantastic! Crispy, meaty, saucy, the whole package. That's when we should have stopped. The pizza must have taken and additional 45-50 from the time the wings were served to hit our table. Okay, I know it takes time but, adding it up, close to 70 minutes to get a pizza? Still, it was hot and looked great. They just forgot the flavor. Bland, really bland. We had pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom and still nothing. I never salt my pizza but, I had no choice. Salt, pepper, red pepper, anything to give it some needed zing. I would have sent it back but, I was running on empty and was under the gun to get back across town so, sending it back was not an option. To boot, service was marginal at best. Put it this way - over an hour at the table and I had two glasses of wine - I would of had another but, the server rarely checked on us. We love Oregano's - absolutely love it! However, judging by some of the reviews and out history here, this location needs a refresher course on Oregano's pizza 101..

9OKj6NaR0tUEuDMERs8ZXg.text: Let me start by stating that the food is always good. I've never had anything at Oregano's that I don't love and this visit was no exception.   My big concern was the service. Our server just seemed disinterested the entire time. It took 35 minutes for our food to come out on a night that was not that busy. There were no apologies offered. One of the orders came out wrong and we had to ask three times for extra napkins. The man waiting us seemed more concerned with the server he was attempting to flirt with than in helping out table. All in all it was a disappointing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocktails

a9SzcObztbM3KSmTj1Lc4Q.text: Well, we have had some good experiences lately. After we sorted out some inconsistencies we have been visiting this location often and all good so far. We really got the feeling that management cares, and that motivates us to support this business. I hope it continues like that because this location is very convenient.

wlVPoGwWO_r5yzt9oE8KKA.text: Have not been this exact location but this is my favorite food, this variety, in entire Phoenix area.  Always great staff and fun atmosphere...and great foods. There is different but none better. Plain cheesecake was excellent. BBQ chicken thin crust pizza also. Soda water drink.

l16jE36t3NH-72HWsJQsAg.text: Update:  Emailed and heard crickets.....Went today and the 'Alfredo' dish was just terrible! Wish I had never ordered that. So gross! The sauce was thin and runny and the pasta was dry and starchy. I'm not master chef, but I can definitely say that I can certainly make a better dish than that! The bread wasn't even that good, but it was honestly the only thing I even sort of enjoyed. Not sure if I'll return,  but I know I'll absolutely never order this gross rendition of Alfredo ever ever again

fBddiAKxlLqJNqtiYt_aWg.text: Celebrating another birthday here today! Greeted with a genuinely sweet hostess who made us feel very welcomed. We sat at the bar while we waited 5 minutes for a table. This place was busy and hopping. We had golden wings with sauce on the side , and the Pablo Picasso chicken salad. Amina was  extremely patient and super friendly as I special ordered almost everything except the pizzookie...  recommend this location for your Oregano's fix!

Wle2DSFVYD2Ck_PL3uei8g.text: Someone please tell me what all the hype is all about.  It's always so busy here!  The food is Good but not that good.  I think the thin crust is way to thin and the sauce is just ok.  There are other pizza places that are more too of My list.  Will we be back...prob but not our first pick.

aLcsSDqTpeJCODi9aba3Qw.text: My family and I enjoy oreganos when you go sit in person. However I am not of fan of ordering to go.  The to go associate forgot to ring in my chicken so I received the incorrect total over the phone. I asked for utensils. When I got to my husbands place of business there were no silverware in the bag.  This type of service has happened to me a couple times with Togo.   Food is always good

3ZH9u8ZChOTp6yT2f0QiVw.text: We had dinner at the PV location on Sept. 5, 2019. Ordered Vino Bambino Salad and Mac & Cheese, both of which we shared. The server brought a big bucket of parmesan cheese to sprinkle over both. We both got food poisoning (vomiting and horrible diarrhea) and were sick for over 24 hours and weak for days. We called the manager, Mike, who told us you can't get sick from salad. He also told us he needed at least two complaints before he could open an investigation. We gave up on him and called corporate. The gentleman we spoke with said that was definitely not the policy, that one complaint opened an investigation. He offered to put us in touch with the insurance company to file a claim, but we only wanted to try to prevent others from getting sick, especially young children. I would give this negative stars if that were possible. Never again for us!

umGpZDNkDYOKrUXJmTvM1A.text: First time I've tried this Oregano's. I had the house salad with a honey balsamic dressing that was delicious the salad was huge! I ordered the Italian wings. Which were heavily covered in a sweet Tangy sauce which had a tiny bite to it. They were good but make sure you have tons of napkins. My husband has an all you can eat pasta and meatballs which I got a few bites of it! My husband always Raves about there delicious spaghetti and meatballs and it's True they're delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice outside seating

FHozi_5dnBgUA9T3EYfRVA.text: This rating is completely based off of orders to go . Unfortunately people shouldn't do any to-go with them because they basically cut corners ! Sitting in the salads are amazing ! They are layered , full of toppings . When you get them to go it's basically lettuce on lettuce . Super frustrated as I would definitely get them more but as you can tell in my picture definitely not worth it !

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lots and lots of lettuce , minimal toppings on the oreganos favorite . Super disappointed

6oXlyFbQ_qJbDZ0GmYeIZw.text: BAD SERVICE. FOOD POISONING. UNDERCOOKED FOOD.  Health grade: F  The moment our party waited for over 90 minutes for seats, was disastrous (were told 30-45min). Advice for the hostess, do not sugarcoat times. The Yelp app was also wrong on the updated waitlist times.   At the time of seating, the hostess called our group from outside and sped walked to the table to place menu's down without anyone following her. She walked so fast, we had to ask her walking back towards us, where the heck she put us.  Once seated, the waiter (Gus), informed our table he'll be with us in a moment - as he takes off without drink/appetizer orders. Meanwhile, half of our table did not sit due to the seats (and table) being covered with food. I know this isn't Steak 44, but nobody wants to sit on fresh spaghetti. Half our table stood for SIX MINUTES until Gus returned, questioning if everything is OK. We requested someone to come clean the cushions. Gus returns 2 minutes later with a hand towel. FYI - when using a hand towel, use HOT water not cold as it'll dry faster.  Service Issue: Although upset with the service, we treated our waiter with respect and positivity. The waiter did opposite with us. We waited on drinks refills for a period of 15 minutes. Previously when dining with Oregano's, the child in our group were offered dough to make their own pizza. This time dining, the waiter did not offer this; however, he offered the pizza dough to 2 children behind us. Perhaps because they only had one more additional child than us.   As we've waited 90 minutes in the heat outside, we were prepared to order our entire meal. As an appetizer, we ordered zucchini and wings. We specifically requested the wings to be EXTRA CRISPY and requested to cook for an additional 15 minutes. The wings came out 10 minutes later. I'm no mathematician, but how can the wings be served, faster than the additional request time? The wings were completely undercooked, ultimately suffering from food poisoning.  As an entree, we ordered the chicken parmesan. The chicken, noodles and cheese were stale. Curious why he delivered the dish saying, "be careful, hot plate." Nothing was hot about it. This dish had been sitting on the counter for delivery for several minutes or intentionally left to harden.   As an entree, we ordered the Stuffed Pizza. We were told it would take approximately one hour to make. The waiter cautioned our table on ordering this as if it's a burden to put in the request to the kitchen staff. We placed the order anyhow, but upon delivery to the table, it appeared to be a pan pizza. We questioned our waiter - if this is the PAN pizza opposed to the STUFFED pizza. He assured us it was stuffed and informed us on how it was made. The disappointing factor, Oregano's online menu (and Yelp) pictures, the dish is filled to the top with ingredients. Our dish was filled half way with the crust noticeably visible. The problem didn't stop there, the pan-stuffed pizza was COLD and the pepperoni was NOT cooked. You're meaning to tell me, the wait time on a pizza is over an hour - to come out cold??  We will never dine with Oregano's restaurant, this location or any other. Caution and urge all the contact the Maricopa County Health Inspector if you've also experienced food poisoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YdMXf0BREu7rnsJMC6dWPA.text: I was introduced to Oregano's when I first moved to Phoenix, and it has been one of my go-to restaurants ever since. Their appetizers and pasta dishes are huge! The guacatony is a favorite appetizer for my husband and me. We usually split a guacatony and a small pizza.....and it's more than plenty! Their pizzas never disappoint. We tried their Chicago-style pizza once when we weren't in a hurry (they let you know up front that it takes a while to bake) and it was really good too. Their pizookie dessert is dirt cheap (only $4.99) and is by far the best pizookie of anywhere I've ever been. Oregano's has mastered the perfect balance of cooked vs. undercooked of the cookie. I have to say, if I had written this review when I was on a vegan diet a few months ago, I would not have been able to give a good review because they have virtually nothing that's vegan. They also appear to not have any gluten-free options. In general, it may not be the best place to go if you have food or allergy restrictions because they don't seem to offer modifications. My only restriction is that I'm a vegetarian, and they have plenty of options for vegetarians.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto pizza
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best pizookie (others will try to duplicate, but Oegano&#39;s is the best)
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacatony (it&#39;s huge)!

re9dDceR17fRXRYOEebV-w.text: This place is an easy spot to take the family. I am not a huge fan of the food but the kids and family like it and that is just personal preference. The waitress was excellent and brought pizza dough for the kids. The patio was nice but slightly so they turned on the heaters. It was a nice day with the family and my kids are crazy so an extra big thank you to the staff!

Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front area where kids could run.

-IgOpNR9EoIDsWmfzNbPAA.text: Terrible service!!! Sitting here for 20 minutes with no drink refills,  no nothing. The  Manager of this place needs to step in and help or something. The Manager, if there is such a thing here should have come out and explained why there so slow. Very pissed off!

MHq6Q_MS7AD9FS8AcIsBUw.text: We love Oregano's and go there often..... mostly for the pan cookie dessert  BUT everything we've had is great and we've also had Oregano's cater several events with great success!   I love the salads, the Vino Bambino in my favorite bit I get it with Italian and ranch instead of the Caesar because it gives it more zest!   The Alfredo in the dark is really yummy if you like Alfredo and you like spice!   The pan pizzas are GREAT and really really cheesy!   Mac and cheese is good, with a nice crunch and chipotle flavor!   We recommend trying them out. And the prices are GREAT! We have a huge feast for $40 with leftovers for 2-4 meals usually!

QW3N3dS0yJrd-pEwN1tUbQ.text: I asked about bar seating for 3 and was seated in booth for 6+. Because we did not want patio seating since is was 107!  The male server was CLEARLY annoyed that it ended up being a party of 3 that was only ordering drinks and getting apps to share.  I told him this about 10 minutes after being seated. He came back to take our drink order ten minuets after we sat down and it took another 5-7 to bring our drinks back to us.   He never came to check on us, despite being next to the bar we had to literally flag him down. His last trip pass was to drop off the check (arrived at 5ish, departure 7ish) even though we had given no indication we were ready and we again had to Flag him down to split it.  We waited a fair/excessive amount of time for drinks and to even order the other appetizer. Again he seemed annoyed that we were ordering a second app and a second round the of drinks. Our tab is was almost $100 and our server acted as if us being there was a huge inconvenience.  Ok food, good drinks, POOR service.

H-lzk9aIOdtF3OfwKbuomQ.text: Consistently good food and drink! We had a group of 7 and got a large Bambino salad (a very robust salad!), an appetizer and 2 large tasty pizza's (we could have done 1 pizza and would not have been hungry, but no left overs!). Reasonable prices too......  So why 4 stars not 5?  Well they have on line waiting list on YELP..... We thought that is great as we had tickets to the Herberger (Live theater downtown for those not in Phoenix), and would be on a time constraint. But then when we went to use it, it only allows for a party of 6. So we called and they said if you do 6 and show up with 7, we have to put you back on the bottom of the list......... They need to fix it, remove the feature or at the very least give some explanation IMHO......................

nTR3a0WCZ8y4Grd9LE2KSg.text: Called ahead to place an order for a pan pizza(deep dish), they said they don't do it anymore... the result- raw dough and half baked pizza... Very disappointing, it was my #1 place for pizza...

pwDqqwEeaMTf6scwbB-prg.text: While the food was good and the service ok, was very disappointed with the Yelp waitlist service.  Got on the waitlist right before we left home, and the service told us 10-14 minutes.  Got there right on time and was told by the hostess that the Yelp waitlist app is VERY inaccurate and would be at least another 20-30 minutes.  Waited over 45 minutes before getting a table, had two small kids with us and they were starving by the time we got our food.  If they know it's inaccurate why bother?  Next time we won't bother.

mEoDxxWlQP8FgXAZT3qodQ.text: We have always enjoyed the Oregano's chain and this one is not much different than the others. My last visit was during the record breaking rain from hurricane Norbert. It was decided to close the shop and have a fun Ferris Bueller's Day off.  This location seems a little smaller the some of the others and can get very busy. They usually have some pretty cool jazz music playing or something that will make you want to tap your foot while you wait.  Usually get one of the the Real Big Salads or a tasty and delicious Thin Crust Pizza. Could not resist ordering the Numero One-O Stuffed Pizza on my last visit. Decided to get it TO GO and it must of weighed ten or twenty pounds.  Food is always pretty tasty and the service is friendly and attentive. Really like their homemade sausage and the Rib Eye Salad. Looking forward to trying out the famous Original Pizza Cookie with Ice Cream for the topper on our next visit.  Located in the PV Mall parking lot in the SE corner next to the candy store. The restaurants in this parking lot are always changing but this one is definitely a keeper. PIZZA ME BABY!  3.75 STARS
